sentences.en: A teacher's aim is to impart knowledge.
sentences.cn: 教师的宗旨就是传授知识.

sentences.en: He was there by invitation , to impart information and to relay requests.
sentences.cn: 他应邀坐在那儿, 随时准备提供情况和回答咨询.

sentences.en: His production of Harold Pinter's play fails to impart a sense of excitement or danger.
sentences.cn: 他所执导的哈罗德·品特的剧作没能表现出紧张、危险感。

sentences.en: I am about to impart knowledge to you that you will never forget.
sentences.cn: 我会向你传授让你终生牢记的知识。

sentences.en: I thought it well to impart my misgivings to President Roosevelt.
sentences.cn: 我认为最好把我的顾虑告知罗斯福总统.

sentences.en: I will impart the interesting news to you.
sentences.cn: 我将告诉你这些有趣的消息.

sentences.en: Monosodium glutamate impart flavo ( u ) r to food.
sentences.cn: 味素 使食品有味道.

sentences.en: She had information that she couldn’t wait to impart.
sentences.cn: 她得到了消息，迫不及待地想告诉别人。

sentences.en: She managed to impart great elegance to the unpretentious dress she was wearing.
sentences.cn: 她使自己朴素的衣着看起来也十分优雅。

sentences.en: She resolved to impart a gently domestic air to the scene.
sentences.cn: 她决定在当时的场景中加添些家庭气氛.

sentences.en: The ability to impart knowledge and command respect is the essential qualification for teachers.
sentences.cn: 具备传授知识并赢得尊敬的能力是对教师的基本要求。

sentences.en: The more specific each signal is, the more information they can impart.
sentences.cn: 每一种信号越有特异性, 那么所能传送的信息就越多.

sentences.en: The red curtains impart a certain elegance to the room.
sentences.cn: 红色的窗帘使房间平添几分雅致.

sentences.en: Use a piece of fresh ginger to impart a East Asian flavour to simple ingredients.
sentences.cn: 用一片鲜姜给简单的原料添上东亚的风味。

sentences.en: Whatever I acquired, I tried to impart to Joe.
sentences.cn: 我只要得到一点知识, 就要设法传授给乔.

sentences.en: Your presence will impart an air of elegance to the party.
sentences.cn: 您的光临将会为宴会增添优雅的气氛.

words.tran_cn: 给予（尤指抽象事物），传授；告知，透露

trans.tran_en: to give information, knowledge, wisdom etc to someone
to give a particular quality to something
